p: The maps of potential distribution of past, present and future of species of the family Ceratophryidae ( S1– S11 Figs) were generated through the DIVA-GIS software—Bioclim [ 22] and MaxEnt [ 23], performing it run for each species separately. The MaxEnt use both pseudo absence and presence data randomly sampled from the calibration area and the Bioclim is an envelope-mode method that depict sites that are located within the geographical space potentially occupied by a species [ 24, 25].
